physical_examinations.vital_signs: Plasma ACE levels: 380 U/L (normal: <52 U/L); CSF ACE levels: 7.3 U/L (normal: <11.5 U/L)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: History of arterial hypertension and transitory neurologic deficits. MRI revealed multiple signal alterations on T2-weighted images without contrast enhancement.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After 1 year of oral prednisolone treatment, neurologic examination results were normal, and transitory neurologic deficits still occurred. Plasma ACE levels remained elevated at 161 U/L with unchanged MRI lesions.
